fields.summary: Embedded image in Documentation does not same as in JIRA instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31147].
  {panel}

When an Administrator is editing the JIRA Announcement Banner, there are two possible "Visibility Level" options:

Public - Show to anyone
Private - Show to logged in users only 

It would be useful to have a third option:

Disable - Banner Inactive

This would allow the administrator to turn the banner on and off without losing the banner.  The banner represents an investment in admin time (getting the colour right, the alignment just-so, etc) and being able to disable the banner means that this work can be re-used without need to archive the HTML text externally.
fields.summary: Disable Option For Announcement Banner

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31138].
  {panel}

Currently, when user 'Share' an issue with multiple users, the system generates a dedicated notification email to each user.

'Share' should have an additional option to choose whether to make the multiple users to be disclosed in the notification email. If selected, the system will then generate one email with all the shared users in the To column visible to each other.

As an example, user A 'Share' an issue with user B, C, and D. Currently, B, C and D will get an email each without knowing who else user A shares the information with.
If additional option is enabled, user A 'Share' an issue with user B, C, and D. They will get an email with all B, C and D's email on the To field. They are aware that this information is 'Shared' between them and able to work with each other.
fields.summary: Users should be aware of other users when sharing issues
REST endpoint for issues should have ordering that respects the screen schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31132].
  {panel}

Hi everyone,

Welcome to the JIRA 6.0 Early Access Program (EAP)!
Thanks for trying out our early look at our next release. You can download the latest EAP release (milestone build, beta or release candidate) [here|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download-eap].

We have an existing issue (JRA-30983) to capture general feedback.  This issue is the place to provide your thoughts on the new JIRA interface design that can be seen in JIRA 6.0 EAP 2 and all future EAP releases.

We really appreciate you taking the time to provide us any feedback on the contents of the EAP.
Simply comment below for any comments you may have.

Cheers,
Bryan, Roy, Mairead, and Josh
JIRA Product Management
fields.summary: EAP Feedback - JIRA 6.0 Atlassian Design Guideline Rollout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31129].
  {panel}

* Create a drop-down custom-field with options A, B, and C.
* Create an issue and leave the value for the field as None.
* Edit the settings of the custom field and set default value to C.
* Edit the field config and set the field as required.
* View the issue you previously created - note that the field still has no value.
* Edit this field.

*Actual*: The drop-down is now set to A.

*Expected*: The drop-down should include the "none" value and have this set as its value. (it should fail on validation if the user does not set a value)
(This would be consistent with what happens on Create Issue when a CF is mandatory but has no default.)
fields.summary: Better handling of "none" option in custom field drop-downs during issue update.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31120].
  {panel}

1) Log in as a JIRA administrator
2) Type "gg" and navigate to Permission Helper
3) Enter a user name.
4) Enter an issue key.
5) Select a permission that that user doesn't have for that issue due to not being a member of a group (not a role).

The message says:
{noformat}
<User Name> is not in the <Group Name> group
You can change this by going to <User Name>'s groups admin and adding him to the mentioned group(s)
{noformat}

This assumes that the user is male, which is incorrect for roughly half of our user base.

This should read
You can change this by going to <User Name>'s groups admin and adding *them* to the mentioned group(s)
fields.summary: JIRA admin helper refers to all users as "him" when talking about groups

fields.description: Estimados Tengo instalado Jira V. 3.12.3 en un cliente queremos migrar a la Versión 5.1 y no podemos se queda en el 92% dela restauración el archivo  a la capacidad del archivo a restaurar (producción)  es de 581.1 MB, He seguido todos los pasos para la actualización y tengo este inconveniente
fields.summary: Error de Migración

fields.description:
I'm using the REST API to contact Atlassian Jira v4.3.3#617-r149616.

I'm using
http://XX.XX.XX.XX:8080/rest/api/2.0.alpha1/issue/FW-YYYY
to read the data for an issue (XX = our server, YYYY = issue key).

It just works fine with the following exception:
When an issue contains a comment from a user which is no longer with our company (his account was removed), then I get the following error response via the REST interface:

{"errorMessages":["Internal server error"],"errors":{}}
fields.summary: REST API delivers INTERNAL SERVER ERROR

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31115].
  {panel}

In the JIRA Workflow Designer it's been found that renaming an Inactive Workflow changes the workflows visual layout in the designer view.

To reproduce:

# Create a new workflow and lay it out as you like
# While it is inactive, rename it, the flash object will refresh
# Observe the change in layout

See screenshots for detail, between the original workflow, and the renamed workflow.
fields.summary: JIRA Workflow Designer - Renaming Inactive Workflow changes layout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31113].
  {panel}

h4. +Current Scenario+
When searching in the Issue Navigator and ordering by Components or Versions, the returned issues are first ordered by Project and only then alphabetically (in case of the components) or version order; which may lead to a bit of confusion. 

h4. +Suggestion+
* As per [Eric's suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-31113?focusedCommentId=426822&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-426822], we should make the issue navigator sort by component/version directly, and the user should manually specify, e.g.: 'order by project, version', if he wants to sort by project first.
* This behavior should be documented to avoid further confusion - possibly with a note under these fields or a general note on the *ORDER BY* section of the [Advanced Searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching] doc.

*Update:* The [Advanced Searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-ORDERBY] page was updated to include an info box below the Order By keyword.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31091].
  {panel}

h3. Summary: 

The current error displayed for background indexing doesn't always accurately represent the problem with the JIRA instance. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a JIRA issue.
# Add a few comments.
# Delete the JIRA issue from {{jiraissue}}. The comments will be orphaned.
# Go to the re-index page.

h3. Expected Results:

JIRA would either handle the orphaned records (in this example, comments) or display a different error.

h3. Actual Results:

The error is displayed, as in the attached screenshot.

h3. Notes:

This can be fixed with modification to the database, as in our [How to Fix the JIRA is Unable to Perform a Background Re-Index at This Time Error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Fix+the+JIRA+is+Unable+to+Perform+a+Background+Re-Index+at+This+Time+Error] KB.
fields.summary: Provide better error descriptions for the new background indexing functionality
Ability to pass information from an email to a JIRA field
Add the ability to trigger a Webhooks for version related events

fields.description:
At the moment, when making a filter using the Advanced Search, the saved filter will remove the extra bracket if it's not needed.  For example, let say the filter is originally:
{code}
(Project = DEMO AND (status = Open OR Assignee = "admin"))
{code}

The above filter will be saved as:
{code}
Project = DEMO AND (status = Open OR Assignee = "admin")
{code}

There is a reason why a user intentionally adds the additional bracket on the query, so that future changes on the JQL query will be easier. 

Another Example, such as complex JQL query is:
Before the filter is saved:
!beforesavedfilter.png!

After the query is saved into a filter:
!savedfilter.png!
fields.summary: Retain the extra bracket on the advanced search when saving a filter

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31083].
  {panel}

Since *JIRA 5.0*, the usage of the dialog box was introduced to allow users create and edit issues and sub-tasks quicker where the aim to this feature is that you do not need to leave the current page or have it reload just to start creating or editing an issue or sub-tasks as per the following documentation:
* [JIRA 5.0 Rapidly create and edit issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+5.0+Release+Notes#JIRA5.0ReleaseNotes-customisabledialogbox].

However, users would like to implement the usage of Virgil together with *JIRA 5.0* and unfortunately, the dialog box does not cater for this. Virgil will work normally if we use the normal *Create Issue* screen instead of the dialog box. A question was raised in [Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/] to address this concern as per the following:
* [Virgil with JIRA 5|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/46967/virgil-with-jira-5]

Are there any updates on this feature whether Virgil will be made available to work well with the dialog box feature? It will be really useful to have this looked at.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31062].
  {panel}

It seems to be not possible to skip the weekends when trying to run a query to search for issues due 'X' days in the future. Even being able to edit within the 'Time Tracking' how many days a week has and how many hours per day.

Scenario:

If I run a query to find all issues of a project that must be done until the next day, I'll have to search for issues with *endOfDay("+1")*. However, when I reach Friday and run the same query, it will try get issues that must be done until Saturday, thus I'll have to edit the query filter to *endOfDay("+3")* to get Monday.

We should be able to skip the weekend since we had configured the 'Time Tracking' to 5 days per week.
fields.summary: Ability to skip weekends when using endOfDay() function

  {panel}

When Trying to project Import from an OnDemand XML backup, the following error is thrown:
{noformat}
Cause:
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericEntity.set] "zip" is not a field of FileAttachment
Stack Trace: [hide]
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericEntity.set] "zip" is not a field of FileAttachment
at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerGet(FutureTask.java:222)
at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:83)
at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskDescriptorImpl.getResult(TaskDescriptorImpl.java:113)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.TaskDescriptorBean.getResult(TaskDescriptorBean.java:73)
{noformat}

This is because the latest OnDemand version is 6.0 while JIRA is still 5.2.x, and project import only works when the XML backup and the JIRA version is the same.  It would be convenient for our users to be able to do project import from OnDemand XML backup to BTF JIRA regardless of the OnDemand version.

----

Another improvement would be to modify the Error Message, perhaps displaying "Unable to do Project Import due to the conflicting version between the instance and the XML backup"

in the dialog use the pull down and select the issue just created
Click link
You get a message that you need to link to an existing issue

Go back to the issue just entered
choose More Actions-->Link issue
in the dialog use the pull down to select the issue you were just looking at
Click link
everything is fine

I'm also attaching screenshots that I took when I was having the problem

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31021].
  {panel}

h3. Summary: 

Please improve JIRA so that when moving an issue from one project to another, if there is a custom field with different contexts for each project it will retain that value. Currently it does not.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create Custom Field with different contexts for Project A & Project B (as in the attached screenshot).
# Create Issue in Project A with one value in the Custom Field.
# Bulk Move the issue to Project B.
# Select the retain check box and complete the move.

h3. Expected Results:

The value would be retained.

h3. Actual Results:

The value is not retained.

h3. Notes:

This happens for both move and bulk move, however move never offers the retain option. It is possible that the context for the target project will not have the same options as the source project - I'm unsure how to suggest best handling of this.
fields.summary: Retain values for a custom field with different contexts when moving the issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31014].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

We have noticed that a project administrator is able to change his project's lead.

This is a security problem in our opinion since the permission scheme grants special rights (e.g. Delete issue) only to the project admin. This can be bypassed by any administrator today and violates our security policies!

Also our project charging is based on the project leads cost center, so the charging could be faked to a dummy account.

If there were some trace regarding the administrators activities the impact for us would not be that high. But the way it is now, is a real security issue for us!

So we suggest to let just the project lead or jira administrator change the project lead. Or at least have some permission "Change project lead" would also help.

Please consider fixing this soon! We have customers that have already complained about this.

Regards,
Dieter
fields.summary: Add new permission level for changing project lead

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31004].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 5 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. While we understand the importance of this issue for our customers with strict password encryption requirements, we have not been able to prioritize development on this issue and it's not in our immediate plans.

JIRA still needs access to the database –  any code to encrypt the DB credentials or the JNDI datasource would have to reside within the application, therefore an attacker who has obtained system-level access to JIRA could still reverse-engineer the implementation and decrypt the password. Therefore you only have "security via obfuscation." Please see [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27457?focusedCommentId=620358&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-620358] on JRASERVER-27457 for more detail.

That said, we do think this is a positive step and want to support you. We hope to implement a solution in the future.
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

JIRA should Encrypt the database password since it's in plain text in the dbconfig.xml file or it could use the integrated authentication with the databases such as MSSQL database.
fields.summary: Encrypt Database Password in dbconfig.xml or use integrated authentication

  {panel}

The IE-mime-type security setting's functionality has evolved over time, but the text has remained the same. We need to update this text to match what this feature actually does.

We should have it have 3 security levels, with descriptions something like:

High: Forces downloading of all attachments. No attachments will be shown inline.
Medium: Allows some attachments inline, such as images.
Low: Enables all forms of content to be shown inline (such as movies and Flash). Atlassian does not recommend using this setting due to the security implications.

Hi everyone,

Welcome to the JIRA 6.0 Early Access Program (EAP)!

Thanks for trying out our early look at our next release. You can download the latest EAP release (milestone build, beta or release candidate) [here|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download-eap]

With the new look and feel changes in JIRA 6.0 as a part of the Atlassian Design Guidelines, we are tracking feedback on the design on a separate issue, JRA-31132.

We really appreciate you taking the time to provide us any feedback on the contents of the EAP.

Simply comment below for any comments you may have.

Cheers,

Bryan, Roy, Mairead, and Josh
JIRA Product Management
